title: Public Service (Retirement Age) Regulations, 2014
content:
21st November, 2014 Statutory Instruments 171
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 63 OF 2014
The Public Service Pensions Act
(Laws, Volume 15, Cap. 260)
The Public Service (Retirement Age)
Regulations, 2014
IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in section thirty-three of
the Public Service Pensions Act, and in consultation with the Board,
the following Regulations are hereby made:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Service Title
(Retirement Age) Regulations, 2014.
2. In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise Interpreta-
requires— tion
“ officer ” means a person serving on pensionable terms in
the Public Service who has been confirmed in the person’s
appointment; and
“ Public Service ” means the Judicial Service, the Civil Service,
the Defence Forces, the Police and Prisons Service, the
Teaching Service and the Zambia Security Intelligence
Service.
3. These Regulations do not apply to— Application
(a) a member of the Defence Force;
(b) an officer of or below the rank of Chief Inspector in the
Police Force; or
(c) an officer of or below the rank of Chief Officer III in the
Prison Service.
4. (1) Notwithstanding section thirty-three of the Act, and Age of
subject to sub-regulation (2), an officer shall retire on the sixty- retirement of
officer
fifth anniversary of the date of the officer’s birth.
(2) Notwithstanding sub-regulation (1), an officer may, on giving
twelve months’ notice, and subject to the approval of the President,
retire on or after attaining the age of sixty or after completing
thirty-five years service, whichever is earlier.
Copies of this Statutory Instrument can be obtained from the Government Printer,
P.O. Box 30136, 10101, Lusaka, Price K2.00 each
